summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, notifying them of the production of additional materials including Jencks Act and Giglio material for potential trial witnesses, as well as materials related to individuals the government does not currently intend to call. The letter details the protective order governing the materials.

events.title: Production of Additional Trial Materials
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces Jencks Act, Giglio material, and other witness statements to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the Ghislaine Maxwell case governing the handling of confidential materials.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Cohen & Gresser LLP, 800 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10022
Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., 150 East Tenth Avenue, Denver, CO 80203
Law Offices of Bobbi C. Stemheim, 33 West 19th Street-4th Fl., New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The government produced Jencks Act and Giglio material for potential witnesses in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.
The government also produced materials related to individuals it does not currently intend to call as witnesses, containing certain witness statements.
All produced materials are governed by a protective order dated July 31, 2020, with specific confidentiality designations.
The letter clarifies the production is a courtesy and does not concede a legal obligation to provide all such materials.
The government reserves the right to call individuals listed in the indices as witnesses at trial, even if not currently intended.
